author: Liam Prenderville
title: Paul Pogba reveals he snubbed Barcelona and Real Madrid to rejoin Manchester United - 'I followed my heart'
text:
Paul Pogba shoots wide (Photo: Reuters) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Paul Pogba has revealed he turned down Barcelona and Real Madrid in the summer. 
The Frenchman rejoined Manchester United for a world record Â£89million after four seasons with Juventus. 
Pogba was linked with a host of top clubs with his transfer saga ongoing for months before he finally returned to Old Trafford. 
And the midfielder has revealed he could have joined either of the Spanish giants. 
"I came to Manchester United because I have certain goals. It is a big challenge for me," Pogba told SFR Sport . Pogba celebrates earlier this term (Photo: REUTERS) Pogba reacts during the draw with Liverpool (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) Read More 
"I could also have joined Real Madrid or Barcelona, who were interested in signing me. But I chose to return to United because I followed my heart. 
"I always told myself that I would one day return to United."
